amendment.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 117-320 to clarify that nothing in the bill should be construed to limit the TSA Administrators authority to immediately impose new security screening procedures or requirements or to address a national security or public safety threat.
amendment.purpose: Amendment sought to clarify that nothing in the bill should be construed to limit the TSA Administrators authority to immediately impose new security screening procedures or requirements or to address a national security or public safety threat.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Cammack amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 204 - 216 (Roll no. 169).

action.text: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A003) pursuant to the rule.
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A003) offered by Mrs. Cammack.
Amendment failed by House: On agreeing to the Cammack amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 204 - 216 (Roll no. 169).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Cammack amendment (A003) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 204 - 216 (Roll no. 169).
